programme.title: The Holiday
Ljubav i praznici
programme.desc:
The Holiday: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jude Law, Jack Black. Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0457939/","name":"The Holiday","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1MDk4MzA2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjQ3NDc3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0457939/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Redriter"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice~ very nice","reviewBody":"This was a really good, light hearted movie, with GREAT characterization. There are points where the movie is a little slow, but not slow enough to loose your interest.

All of the characters are wonderfully developed especially Jude Laws-the under-story of Jude's character adds an extra dimension to his character and really makes you love him all the more.

Kate Winslet's character is another that was well worked out. She helps out this little old man . . . and the character development between her and this older gentleman is wonderful . . . it adds so much to her character, makes her more human, more real, someone very likable and someone you want to end up with a good ending.

Jack Black's character was sweet, not corny . . . and you end up liking him very much. He was not a goober like he usually is in his movies.

Over all, it was a wonderfully character driven movie, that was enjoyable and had you leaving the theater feeling good. I recommend it highly!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":272438,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-12-13","keywords":"kiss,film composer,english countryside,cottage,book editor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Holiday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3321037081","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Romeo + Juliet
Romeo i Julija
programme.desc: Romeo + Juliet: Directed by Baz Luhrmann. With Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, John Leguizamo, Harold Perrineau. Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117509/","name":"Romeo + Juliet","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGU4YmI1ZGQtZjExYi00M2E0LTgyYTAtNzQ5ZmVlMTk4NzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117509/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neon47"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Moderized Without Losing the Shakespeare","reviewBody":"I'm a sucker for William Shakespeare even though I like it done better in the theatre. This one however, kept my attention and seemed to do a great job with modernizing the whole quarreling families thing. The movie kicks off with a street brawl between the Montegues and Capulets. The Prince forewarns them that if they ever disturb the peace again their "lives will pay the forfeit of the peace." We are then introduced to the character Romeo who is played by Leonardo DeCaprio. Leo does a great job as Romeo, but that's because Leo is a good actor in this film. Soon after that we are introduced to Juliet who is played by the beautiful Claire Danes, someone I haven't seen in too many movies. Danes does a great job playing the flirty Juliet. The movie follows the original script very accurately. The symbolism is also used very well throughout the movie. If you look at the guns you'll notice that some say sword, some say rapier, and I believe some say dagger. The Montegues always wear a Hawaiian style shirt. The Capulets dress more like mobsters or thugs even though both sides could be viewed as thugs in some sort or another. In either case each family wears a certain kind of clothing that makes it easy to tell who's who. One great part I absolutely love is the party. Juliet wears angel wings and Romeo wears a knight outfit. Romeo's best friend (and I wish I could spell his name but I'd rather not butcher it) dresses up as a women. So to explain this form of symbolics, for those who aren't getting it, it's Romeo is the "knight in shinning armor," Juliet is the angel of Romeo's dreams, and Romeo's best friend is the comic relief. There's other things you'll notice at the party also, like Tybalt wears devil horns(i.e. he's a villain). Both families you'll also notice are rich, which also follows the script accurately. Overall, if you're a Shakespeare fan, a fan of romantic movies, a fan of tragic movies, or a fan of artistic movies then make sure to look into this one. It'll sweep you off you're feet, make you laugh, make you cry, and make you fall in love.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":220597,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-11-01","keywords":"love,gangster,female nudity,sex scene,suicide","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Romeo + Juliet","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi58720537","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU1OTJjMTItN2I4OC00ZDI2LWFhMDktNjYwN2Q3NjRmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU1OTJjMTItN2I4OC00ZDI2LWFhMDktNjYwN2Q3NjRmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000138/","name":"Leonardo DiCaprio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000491/","name":"John Leguizamo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062619/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091365/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000636/","name":"William Shakespeare"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668902/","name":"Craig Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Jack Black's character was sweet, not corny . . . and you end up liking him very much. He was not a goober like he usually is in his movies.

Over all, it was a wonderfully character driven movie, that was enjoyable and had you leaving the theater feeling good. I recommend it highly!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":272438,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-12-13","keywords":"kiss,film composer,english countryside,cottage,book editor","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Holiday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3321037081","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"],"duration":"PT2H16M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Romeo i Julija
programme.desc: Šekspirova čuvena drama u novom, modernom ruhu u predgrađu Verone, sa originalnim dijalozima. Klasična priča o Romeu i Juliji modernizovana je i prebačena u okrug američkog Verona Biča, u kojem žive dve međusobno zavađene porodice, Montagei i Kapuleti. Međutim, dvoje najmlađih pripadnika tih porodica, Romeo i Julija, upoznaju se i zaljubljuju, ali svoju ljubav moraju skrivati od sveta jer vrlo dobro znaju kako im roditelji nikada ne bi dopustili da budu zajedno. Tragični će ljubavnici na svome putu naići na mnoštvo prepreka, neke će uspeti svladati, a druge će, na žalost, smatrati nerešivima.

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
Skrivena lepota
programme.desc: Collateral Beauty: Directed by David Frankel. With Will Smith, Edward Norton, Kate Winslet, Michael Peña. Retreating from life after a tragedy, a man questions the universe by writing to Love, Time, and Death. Receiving unexpected answers, he begins to see how these things interlock and how even loss can reveal moments of meaning and beauty." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4682786/","name":"Collateral Beauty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5ODE4MTY2NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzM2NzEzMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Retreating from life after a tragedy, a man questions the universe by writing to Love, Time, and Death. Receiving unexpected answers, he begins to see how these things interlock and how even loss can reveal moments of meaning and bea","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4682786/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"easkeen"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"I'm glad I didn't listen to negative reviews....","reviewBody":"Because I really liked this movie. Its a drama...and it was slow to unfold but the message was beautiful. It makes you sad, angry, question...but in the end you learn that ALL those emotions are life and love and I thought the performances portrayed that perfectly. I think you either get that message or you don't. The acting was phenomenal including some real surprise performances. Don't go in expecting cheesy happy "Christmas miracle" endings. Don't expect a block-buster big bang edge of your seat thriller....expect a beautiful film that is taking a difficult topic(s) and turning it into a thing of beauty.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":97393,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2016-12-16","keywords":"anguish,husband wife relationship,loss,death,letter","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1307227673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNzA0ODU1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTU0ODY1MDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNzA0ODU1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTU0ODY1MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Retreating from life after a tragedy, a man questions the universe by writing to Love, Time and Death. programme.title: Pain & Gain
Znojem do love
programme.desc:
Pain & Gain: Directed by Michael Bay. With Mark Wahlberg, Dwayne Johnson, Anthony Mackie, Tony Shalhoub. A trio of bodybuilders in Florida get caught up in an extortion ring and a kidnapping scheme that goes terribly wrong." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1980209/","name":"Pain & Gain","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NDE5NTU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI1OTMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A trio of bodybuilders in Florida get caught up in an extortion ring and a kidnapping scheme that goes terribly wrong.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1980209/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"GBDaddy"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprising Film - Not What I Expected","reviewBody":"I wasn't thrilled with the movie, but that doesn't mean it was not good. Actually, I think this film had incredible substance, due particularly in part to the casting. I would have given it 7 stars, but the length of the film took it down a notch (they could have knocked off 14-19 minutes worth of unnecessary, and sometimes boring footage).

The film started off with Wahlberg seeming to be just like Wahlberg. But, long story short, he and the film evolved to a character that fit him (and vice versa). Based upon the plot, I think it was a good match.

Dwayne Johnson is not brand new to drama, but this was a different kind of role nonetheless. I don't feel he was 100% there, but his likable character makes you just ignore it. I think with a few more roles like this, he'll be better.

I'm not that familiar with Mackie, but he did a great job in his role. Apart from Shalhoub, he was probably one of the most believable characters. He made me think of a subdued and more serious version of Mike Epps.

Shalhoub....well, what can you say about this guy? He was awesome in Monk, and his style is always great. He is a talented actor and the casting of him was a solid choice. He has that goof look to him, yet his face can show some noteworthy seriousness. This was no Giamatti being cast as a thug...Shalhoub can pull off a "tough guy" pretty well.

I've always been fond of Ed Harris, but his role was insignificant. Same for Corddry.

All in all, this was a well-made film deserving to be watched. I doubt I would ever watch it again due to it's slow development at times, but I'm glad I did see it. The casting was unexpected and unique.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":210717,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2013-04-24","keywords":"bodybuilder,kidnapping,based on true story,female nudity,bikini","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2518853401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNTI4NTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY3MDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNTI4NTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY3MDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A trio of bodybuilders in Florida get caught up in an extortion ring and a kidnapping scheme that goes terribly wrong. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1107001/","name":"Anthony Mackie"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033149/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0707555/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321655/","name":"Christopher Markus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321656/","name":"Stephen McFeely"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2431017/","name":"Pete Collins"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1980209, Title: Pain & Gain, --- Description: Pain & Gain: Directed by Michael Bay. With Mark Wahlberg, Dwayne Johnson, Anthony Mackie, Tony Shalhoub. A trio of bodybuilders in Florida get caught up in an extortion ring and a kidnapping scheme that goes terribly wrong." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1980209/","name":"Pain & Gain","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NDE5NTU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI1OTMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A trio of bodybuilders in Florida get caught up in an extortion ring and a kidnapping scheme that goes terribly wrong.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1980209/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"GBDaddy","dateCreated":"2013-06-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprising Film - Not What I Expected","reviewBody":"I wasn't thrilled with the movie, but that doesn't mean it was not good. Actually, I think this film had incredible substance, due particularly in part to the casting. I would have given it 7 stars, but the length of the film took it down a notch (they could have knocked off 14-19 minutes worth of unnecessary, and sometimes boring footage).

The film started off with Wahlberg seeming to be just like Wahlberg. But, long story short, he and the film evolved to a character that fit him (and vice versa). Based upon the plot, I think it was a good match.

Dwayne Johnson is not brand new to drama, but this was a different kind of role nonetheless. I don't feel he was 100% there, but his likable character makes you just ignore it. I think with a few more roles like this, he'll be better.

I'm not that familiar with Mackie, but he did a great job in his role. Apart from Shalhoub, he was probably one of the most believable characters. He made me think of a subdued and more serious version of Mike Epps.

Shalhoub....well, what can you say about this guy? He was awesome in Monk, and his style is always great. He is a talented actor and the casting of him was a solid choice. He has that goof look to him, yet his face can show some noteworthy seriousness. This was no Giamatti being cast as a thug...Shalhoub can pull off a "tough guy" pretty well.

I've always been fond of Ed Harris, but his role was insignificant. Same for Corddry.

All in all, this was a well-made film deserving to be watched. I doubt I would ever watch it again due to it's slow development at times, but I'm glad I did see it. The casting was unexpected and unique.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":210717,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2013-04-24","keywords":"bodybuilder,kidnapping,based on true story,female nudity,bikini","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2518853401","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNTI4NTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY3MDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNTI4NTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY3MDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A trio of bodybuilders in Florida get caught up in an extortion ring and a kidnapping scheme that goes terribly wrong. ","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1107001/","name":"Anthony Mackie"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033149/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0707555/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321655/","name":"Christopher Markus","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321656/","name":"Stephen McFeely","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2431017/","name":"Pete Collins"],"duration":"PT2H9M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Deep Impact
Veliki udar
programme.desc:
Deep Impact: Directed by Mimi Leder. With Robert Duvall, Téa Leoni, Elijah Wood, Vanessa Redgrave. A comet is discovered to be on a collision course with Earth. As doomsday nears, the human race prepares for the worst." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120647/","name":"Deep Impact","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTUwMTY1YmMtN2U5NC00YjkzLTg0YWQtZmEwNTEzZjdkNzQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A comet is discovered to be on a collision course with Earth. As doomsday nears, the human race prepares for the worst.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120647/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brijess-2"},"dateCreated":"1999-07-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very moving.","reviewBody":"I found Deep Impact to be a very good "study" on how we has humans, may react to an E.L.E. (see this movie for details on that.) The special effects were good, but the best thing about this movie was the focus on the characters. This wasn't loud and stupid as "that other asteroid movie." This film will entertain you and mostly, touch your heart. You actually feel the doom that is about to reach these people, and to me, that is good film making.

About the only thing I could pick on would be the performance of Téa Leoni. To me, she was never convincing. She seemed down and depressed all of the time, even when she was doing the news. Very odd performance.

I give this film a B+","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":173072,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1998-05-08","keywords":"disaster,comet,saving the world mission,giant wave,president","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000380/","name":"Robert Duvall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000704/","name":"Elijah Wood"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001460/","name":"Mimi Leder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019166/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748022/","name":"Bruce Joel Rubin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0866062/","name":"Michael Tolkin"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending

programme.title: Hulk
Hulk
programme.desc:
Hulk: Directed by Ang Lee. With Eric Bana, Jennifer Connelly, Sam Elliott, Josh Lucas. Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0286716/","name":"Hulk","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQwZDg1MGEtN2E5My00ZDJlLWI4MzItM2U2MjJhYzlkNmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAxNjkxNjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CGA_Soupdragon"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very impressive!","reviewBody":"I finally caught up with the film on DVD, after missing its cinema release and just not having the urge to see it until now. It has had some rather bad press, so I wasn't actually expecting very much.

One of the reasons I have waited so long was to let my son, (who is now eight) grow up a bit before seeing it. He was interested in the tie-in products filling the shelves in all the stores on release. A blanket-marketing ploy that is becoming more and more hysterical, I fear.

Another was that I was wary of renting it as the Hulk character has been rather mal-treated in live-action form.

Until Ang Lee's film.

Firstly, this isn't by any stretch of the imagination, a kids' film. Though my younger children watched it, it gave them serious food for thought about what scientists do to animals and people in the name of science. My oldest was enthralled. She appreciated Lee's magnificent use of the film medium.

This is a very dark movie. The origin-story has been manipulated and updated linking the two lead characters (Bana and Connelly) in a sorrowful, fearful event that happened to them both in their childhood. Nice touch.

"Banner's" (Eric Bana's) father (played by Nick Nolte) shuffles back into his life after 30 years incarceration for causing the events that had traumatized the young Banner. Banner later finds that his father had "experimented" on him when they were still a whole family. This creepy device effectively modernizes the story and it's ultimate revelation is a clever way of releasing the pent-up rage that Banner jr has locked within his mind. This rage feeds the Hulk. Banner finally becomes the Hulk after some incredible bravery in the lab.

The film's effects are superb. I am a very happy viewer. This is great cinema. A wonderful adaptation of a tortured, misunderstood human being.

Highly recommended, by me, for true Hulk fans."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":261186,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2003-06-20","keywords":"radiation,monster,scientist,general,technology","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hulk","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1139409177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQyNGIxMzctM2NkYy00ZWY4LWIwN2MtYzJmNDQ3MDJiNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQyNGIxMzctM2NkYy00ZWY4LWIwN2MtYzJmNDQ3MDJiNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0051509/","name":"Eric Bana"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000124/","name":"Jennifer Connelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000385/","name":"Sam Elliott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000487/","name":"Ang Lee"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0095134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092570/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0498278/","name":"Stan Lee"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456158/","name":"Jack Kirby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0770005/","name":"James Schamus"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: American Pie 2
Američka pita 2
programme.desc:
American Pie 2: Directed by J.B. Rogers. With Jason Biggs, Shannon Elizabeth, Alyson Hannigan, Chris Klein. Jim and his friends are now in college, and they decide to meet up at the beach house for some fun." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0252866/","name":"American Pie 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTEyYjhiMjYtNjU3YS00NmQ4LTlhNTEtYTczNWY3MGJmNzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jim and his friends are now in college, and they decide to meet up at the beach house for some fun.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0252866/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mattymatt4ever"},"dateCreated":"2002-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent sequel","reviewBody":"I saw the movie in theaters and laughed out loud. Now, I rented the DVD. I can't say I got as many laughs as the first time, though, and I started to notice more flaws. At first I thought this movie was better than the original. Now I'm not sure. They both have great redeeming qualities that pretty much balance the scale.

The two films movie at a similar rhythm. In the original, we opened with Jim's Dad walking in on him while masturbating. In the sequel, he walks in on him while he's having sex, only it's taken to the next level with the girlfriend's parents walking in as well. And we have the keg party, with a Steadicam shot following Stiffler around, who yet again gets into a mishap with bodily fluids. And of course, in homage of the famous Nadia scene from the original, we have the guys walking in on two lesbians.

 The laughs are still there, and there are some genuinely funny moments. I don't want to give them away, though the previews and some of the other reviewers probably already did.

The cast still got it. Eugene Levy steals the show yet again as Jim's Dad. I do have to say, Stiffler's character got a little too obnoxious at times. It's often funny to hear his foul-mouthed insults, but by the hundredth time you hear him use the word "f**kface" it gets kinda old.

 I'm always going to hold the "American Pie" movies several notches above the standard gross-out teen comedies, because they have zest and originality. Not to mention they're done in a professional manner. The gags are as intelligent as they are crude, and delivered with exquisite timing. And to top it off, it's a heartfelt film that is not literally all about getting laid. I thought the original had more heart to it, but the sequel also has its heart in the right place.

The music is great. The soundtrack is full of really cool songs, including "Smooth Criminal" by Alien Ant Farm. And be sure to check out the unrated DVD special edition. The commentary is cool and--unlike with the first "American Pie" unrated edition--there is some bonus footage worth checking out. The lesbian scene is extended significantly. In the theatrical version, there was only a brief nudity, but you get to see much more in this version.

I'm still not sure if I would consider this movie better than the first, but it is one sequel that lives up to the original--and that's saying a lot!

My score: 7 (out of 10)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":248864,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2001-08-10","keywords":"coitus,female nudity,college student,reference to safe sex,female removes her clothes","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"American Pie 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4043966233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJlNzYzY2YtOWM5MS00M2U1LWE4OTItZTQwYjVkNDY0MWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJlNzYzY2YtOWM5MS00M2U1LWE4OTItZTQwYjVkNDY0MWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Teaser trailer for this comedy follow up"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004755/","name":"Jason Biggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005405/","name":"Seann William Scott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002436/","name":"Shannon Elizabeth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736930/","name":"J.B. Rogers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033633/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0100462/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381221/","name":"Adam Herz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0825738/","name":"David H. Steinberg"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

 I'm always going to hold the "American Pie" movies several notches above the standard gross-out teen comedies, because they have zest and originality. Not to mention they're done in a professional manner. The gags are as intelligent as they are crude, and delivered with exquisite timing. And to top it off, it's a heartfelt film that is not literally all about getting laid. I thought the original had more heart to it, but the sequel also has its heart in the right place.

The music is great. The soundtrack is full of really cool songs, including "Smooth Criminal" by Alien Ant Farm. And be sure to check out the unrated DVD special edition. The commentary is cool and--unlike with the first "American Pie" unrated edition--there is some bonus footage worth checking out. The lesbian scene is extended significantly. In the theatrical version, there was only a brief nudity, but you get to see much more in this version.

I'm still not sure if I would consider this movie better than the first, but it is one sequel that lives up to the original--and that's saying a lot!

Hopeless dweeb Elliot Richards is granted seven wishes by the Devil to snare Allison, the girl of his dreams, in exchange for his soul." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0230030/","name":"Bedazzled","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODgxOTg5OGUtOWViMC00NjM5LWEyMTQtN2M4NTBjYWUzOWUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hopeless dweeb Elliot Richards is granted seven wishes by the Devil to snare Allison, the girl of his dreams, in exchange for his soul.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0230030/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"=G="},"dateCreated":"2001-05-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hurley and O'Connor in the same movie? There must be a God!","reviewBody":""Bedazzled" tells of a tech support geek (need I say more?) who sells his soul to the devil (Hurley) for seven wishes which he attempts to use to get close to a girl at work (O'Connor). The flick is a situational comedy which takes the audience on a fun ride as Fraser's wishes turn him into one exaggerated comic-book-type caricature after another. A cute flick sans slapstick, pratfalls, and jokes, "Bedazzled" offers lots of outrageous situations, some sentimental moments, and a whiff of philosophy. A fun watch with a cute ending, lots of eye candy for the guys, and Fraser doing what he does best playing a big, naive, smiling guy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101399,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2001-01-31","keywords":"gay,john wilkes booth character,soul,devil,dream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bedazzled","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2293825817","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2NjNDI0NTItNjQxYi00YTk2LWFhZTgtODc2YTg4YmY3YjAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2NjNDI0NTItNjQxYi00YTk2LWFhZTgtODc2YTg4YmY3YjAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000409/","name":"Brendan Fraser"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000167/","name":"Elizabeth Hurley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0640323/","name":"Frances O'Connor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000601/","name":"Harold Ramis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017013/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177228/","name":"Peter Cook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001545/","name":"Dudley Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0312205/","name":"Larry Gelbart"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Beethoven
Betoven
programme.desc: Beethoven: Directed by Brian Levant. With Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Dean Jones, Nicholle Tom. A slobbering St. Bernard becomes the center of attention for a loving family, but must contend with a dog-napping veterinarian and his henchmen." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0103786/","name":"Beethoven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODgwY2MyMTItMzY1OC00YmU3LTlhOWMtYWFkNGJjNzIwOWZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A slobbering St. Bernard becomes the center of attention for a loving family, but must contend with a dog-napping veterinarian and his henchmen.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0103786/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2009-10-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"5.1??? As bad as all that? I don't think so!","reviewBody":"I really liked Beethoven. Of course it isn't perfect, it does have a silly ending, the plot does have its low points and the script was a tad weak in places. However, it is a charming, fun and entertaining family movie. I myself am mortified at the 5.1 IMDb rating. I seriously don't think it is as bad as all that. It isn't perfect, but it has a sense of fun. The cinematography is lush and very beautifully handled, and the direction was secure. Charles Grodin is an enormously talented actor, and I enjoyed his performance here, and Dean Jones seems to be having fun too. The child actors are appealing, and the music is lovely. I think the real star is Beethoven himself, whoever trained that dog should be told he/she did a wonderful job. With Beethoven, the film is fun, charming and very entertaining. And there are many memorable moments here. All in all, a very pleasant family film, I recommend it. It is not perfect, but it is one of the better family films out there. 7/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70033,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"1992-04-03","keywords":"dog,animal,family relationships,dysfunctional family,animal actor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3578183449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzUyOGViZGMtY2M2Ny00MmQ5LTgzZTAtMTU5YWVjYmNlODE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzUyOGViZGMtY2M2Ny00MmQ5LTgzZTAtMTU5YWVjYmNlODE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001301/","name":"Charles Grodin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001372/","name":"Bonnie Hunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0427894/","name":"Dean Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054830/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000455/","name":"John Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0427468/","name":"Amy Holden Jones"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Betoven
programme.desc: Porodica iz predgrađa usvaja štene bernandinca, uprkos protestima njihovog zaguljenog oca i ono uskoro odrasta u velikog psa. Kada je tatin posao u opasnosti, Betoven dolazi u pomoć. Harvi i Vernon su lopovi koji rade "po narudžbi". Jedne noći provaliće u prodavnicu kućnih ljubimaca i ukrasti više kaveza sa štenadima. Dok ih voze u kamionu, dva štenca će pobeći. Jedan od njih ušunjaće se u kuću porodice Njuton. Džordž Njuton i njegova žena Elis su vlasnici male firme koja proizvodi osveživače prostorija. Džordž je čistunac i ne želi psa u kući, ali njegovo troje dece Ris, Ted i najmanja Emili jako žele psa. A sad se pas našao u njihovoj kući, u Emilnom krevetu! U prvi čas su pomislili da je tata želeo da im priredi iznenađenje, ali on će ih u tome ljutito razuveriti. Međutim, tata će popustiti i oni će zadržati psa i dati mu ime Betoven. Betoven brzo raste, a a porodica svata da ima - bernardinca! Deca ga obožavaju, a tata podnosi. I sve bi bilo lepo da se lokalni veterinar dr. Herman Varni ne bavi i prljavim poslovima. Od proizvođača pištolja primiće novac kako bi na velikim psima izbliza isprobao učinak novog rasprskavajućeg oružja. Kako je Betoven najveći pas u njihovom malom gradu, odmah će baciti oko na njega.

A cute flick sans slapstick, pratfalls, and jokes, "Bedazzled" offers lots of outrageous situations, some sentimental moments, and a whiff of philosophy. programme.title: La teta y la luna
Mesec i sisa
programme.desc:
La teta y la luna: Directed by Bigas Luna. With Biel Duran, Mathilda May, Gérard Darmon, Miguel Poveda. A child cannot stand the idea of having a new brother and dreams about drinking milk from the breasts of his mother again. The child asks the moon to bring him a teet only for him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0111403/","name":"La teta y la luna","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjcwNTE2YzgtNjM0OC00MzA3LTg3ZjctYzkwYmJhNTBhY2FmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A child cannot stand the idea of having a new brother and dreams about drinking milk from the breasts of his mother again. The child asks the moon to bring him a teet only for him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0111403/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tedg"},"dateCreated":"2007-05-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lactitude","reviewBody":"I recently saw Iñárritu's most recent experiment with cinematic narrative, so I pulled this out. I've been saving it for such an occasion, where I need something from a Spanish mind that is as direct as anything in Hollywood.

But it involves two things that Hollywod just cannot seem to do: pre-adolescent wonder about sex, and genuine magical realism. I don't like the term because it is at once too broad (like "surrealism" and "irony") and at the same time usually expressed too simply. Here, the magical worlds we shift in and out of are worlds driven by lactation: one of a boy's fantasy yearning a the second of the physics of what he encounters explained through that world. And there's a third which is shared only between us as adults and the filmmaker.

That adult magical world is populated by a French couple: a young dancer played by the desirable Mathilda May and her husband who performs with her. His stage skill is farting, and he bills himself as the man of fire, appearing in fire-painted leathers and with a motorcycle as prop, both for the stage show and the film proper.

There's a magical folding of course between the show they put on, the one confabulated by the boy, the one we see in the film, and one managed by the boys' dad. In this latter case, the boy strives to be the top of a penis constructed of men. It begins the film where the boy fails and ends with him fully erect, imagining May's breasts, suckling both her's and his mother's.

The French performing farter is loosely based on a real French performer: Joseph Pujol, billed as Le Pétomane. He was the most successful entertainer in late nineteenth century France. 

This film isn't Spanish at all, instead from a land called Catalonia, a quite unique land that some would say is temporarily occupied by Spain. Its a rather wonderful place which includes Barcelona. The language is more impulsive than French, more languidly sensual than Italian and far more pleasing to the ear than Spanish. The child asks the moon to bring him a teet only for him.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0111403/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"tedg","dateCreated":"2007-05-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lactitude","reviewBody":"I recently saw Iñárritu's most recent experiment with cinematic narrative, so I pulled this out. I've been saving it for such an occasion, where I need something from a Spanish mind that is as direct as anything in Hollywood.

But it involves two things that Hollywod just cannot seem to do: pre-adolescent wonder about sex, and genuine magical realism. I don't like the term because it is at once too broad (like "surrealism" and "irony") and at the same time usually expressed too simply. Here, the magical worlds we shift in and out of are worlds driven by lactation: one of a boy's fantasy yearning a the second of the physics of what he encounters explained through that world. And there's a third which is shared only between us as adults and the filmmaker.

That adult magical world is populated by a French couple: a young dancer played by the desirable Mathilda May and her husband who performs with her. His stage skill is farting, and he bills himself as the man of fire, appearing in fire-painted leathers and with a motorcycle as prop, both for the stage show and the film proper.

There's a magical folding of course between the show they put on, the one confabulated by the boy, the one we see in the film, and one managed by the boys' dad. In this latter case, the boy strives to be the top of a penis constructed of men. It begins the film where the boy fails and ends with him fully erect, imagining May's breasts, suckling both her's and his mother's.

The French performing farter is loosely based on a real French performer: Joseph Pujol, billed as Le Pétomane. He was the most successful entertainer in late nineteenth century France. 

This film isn't Spanish at all, instead from a land called Catalonia, a quite unique land that some would say is temporarily occupied by Spain. Its a rather wonderful place which includes Barcelona. The language is more impulsive than French, more languidly sensual than Italian and far more pleasing to the ear than Spanish. It borders on France and has been influenced linguistically at least by that proximity. But just as the Brazilains make fun of the Portuguese, so the Catalons make fun of the French. You have to know that to appreciated the lack of wholeness the French couple has, plus jokes like the French loaf for a penis.

Performing: the couple performs on stage; the little boy on top of the human phallus; the older teen on the woman (and singing to her); and certain nipples produce on call.

Ted's Evaluation -- 3 of 3: Worth watching.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3082,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-03-29","keywords":"jealousy,bare breasts,breast feeding a grown child,three men in love with same woman,adultery","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0244483/","name":"Biel Duran","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000528/","name":"Mathilda May","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201462/","name":"Gérard Darmon"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000940/","name":"Bigas Luna"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009576/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0080706/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016450/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0054523/","name":"Josep Bargalló","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0133561/","name":"Cuca Canals","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0489448/","name":"Frédéric Lasaygues"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Abus de faiblesse
Zloupotreba slabosti
programme.desc:
Abus de faiblesse: Directed by Catherine Breillat. With Isabelle Huppert, Kool Shen, Laurence Ursino, Christophe Sermet. A stroke-afflicted filmmaker is manipulated by a notorious con man." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2418372/","name":"Abus de faiblesse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAzOTU3MzczNTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDA5MzQxMjIx._V1_.jpg","description":"A stroke-afflicted filmmaker is manipulated by a notorious con man.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2418372/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul_imseih"},"dateCreated":"2014-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"An extraordinarily subtle and ultimately devastating film....","reviewBody":"Having just watched this film at the Melbourne Film Festival where Breillat introduced the film, I can say that it is the most approachable and moving film she has made in recent memory.

While the film reduces Breillat's usual focus on sexuality and sexual power, it more than makes up for in its humane but disturbing focus on other power elements in relationships within and across modern bourgeois families and those classes below. I think that too few reviewers miss the class critique presented by Breillat but it is there and adds a whole new layer of significance to this film.

Basing the story on her own real-life experience of being defrauded by a major con, this autobiographical account of sudden disability from stroke and the manipulative strangers who take advantage of her sets up an austere, quietly unsettling premise as a platform for Isabelle Huppert's extraordinary performance as Breillat's alter-ego, Maud.

Whereas Breillat's previous films sometimes fail in her use of non-professional actors lacking range or depth of performance, Huppert fills this role with a technical brilliance and emotional and intellectual depth that allows the viewer to gain some hold on the rationale behind a woman's almost willing complicity in a swindling of which she is the unfortunate target. The word "victim" hardly seems appropriate here. Breillat and Huppert are reaching for something else.

You'll need to see the film to reach your own conclusion of this elusive "something else". It's enough to say that the film remains gripping throughout and thoroughly watchable, not least for the shimmering, alchemical performance by Huppert who is at the height of her powers in this performance.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1087,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-02-12","keywords":"male underwear,cell phone,timeframe 2010s,filmmaker,con man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Abuse of Weakness","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4125014553","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWY0OWIyMGEtMmY4Yi00Yzc3LWE2NTktYTgxNWFhYTUyZjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWY0OWIyMGEtMmY4Yi00Yzc3LWE2NTktYTgxNWFhYTUyZjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Abuse of Weakness"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0791480/","name":"Kool Shen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1801745/","name":"Laurence Ursino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0106924/","name":"Catherine Breillat"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0356282/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078811/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0423921/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0106924/","name":"Catherine Breillat"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bab el hadid
Glavna železnička stanica
programme.desc: Bab el hadid: Directed by Youssef Chahine. With Farid Shawqi, Hind Rustum, Youssef Chahine, Hassan el Baroudi. A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0051390/","name":"Bab el hadid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE1YTc4MTEtNGFkZC00YmFkLWFiZDItOTljMTI1YTM2NDRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4NzAzNjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0051390/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chaos-rampant"},"dateCreated":"2009-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark character-driven film with psychosexual undertones","reviewBody":"I don't really agree with certain circles who claim Cairo Station "one of the greatest films ever made" but it's a neat little film. It has that very basic, almost primitive, shooting style and editing which in some ways reminds of me Greek romance melodramas from the same time yet the perverse content sets it worlds apart from that kind of populist cinema which I suspect was as popular with lower/middle-class audiences in Egypt as it was in Greece. I liked that Chahine makes the titular railway station a stage for contrast between the old and the new. Between fashionable swinging Egyptians and the traditional Muslim conservatives. Between a lady president dressed in a modern pantsuit and destitute girls selling soda to the passengers. Between the old feudal faction of porters and the new one trying to assert its working rights by forming a union. This sociopolitical contrast touching on contemporary changes in Egyptian society (which, other than what the movie presents, I know nothing about but seem to be almost identical with the anxieties that surfaced in Greek screwball comedies of the same time) reflected in the movie itself, out of a typical melodrama of thwarted love Chahine dragging a dark noirish thriller with psychosexual undertones and an almost slasher-like turn in the third act replete with knife-wielding crazies chasing beautiful women that predates Psycho by a good two years. In borrowing the generic aspects of a programme picture for his character-driven piece and portraying his mentally imbalanced protagonist with sympathy and humanity, Chahine made a movie more wholesome than its 73 minute duration would suggest."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4175,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1962-01-16","keywords":"train,working class,labor union,union,buxom","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790096/","name":"Farid Shawqi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744600/","name":"Hind Rustum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149631/","name":"Youssef Chahine"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149631/","name":"Youssef Chahine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011976/","name":"Abdel Hai Adib"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0009455/","name":"Mohamed Abu Youssef"}],"duration":"PT1H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Le fate ignoranti
Naivne vile
programme.desc:
Le fate ignoranti: Directed by Ferzan Ozpetek. With Margherita Buy, Stefano Accorsi, Serra Yilmaz, Gabriel Garko. After a deathly car accident, Antonia starts dating her husband's friends and finds the truth about his life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0274497/","name":"Le fate ignoranti","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQwMmU2N2EtNWU2Yi00NzY5LWFlZjUtNjBiOGVhNzAwNzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIzNDU1NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a deathly car accident, Antonia starts dating her husband's friends and finds the truth about his life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0274497/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wisewebwoman"},"dateCreated":"2007-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"A redefinition of family","reviewBody":"This was a chance rental, recommended by the owner of my local rental shop and it was a wonderful surprise. We are introduced to the perfect marriage at the outset, Antonia, the wife (played winningly by Margherita Buy) and Massimo, the husband ( played by Andrea Renzi) It is fifteen years along into the marriage straight out of high school and it is sexy and fulfilling, with a wonderful house on a lake, a full time maid and no children by choice.

And just like that, Massimo is killed in a traffic accident and thus begins the story of the unfolding of the secret that he withheld from Antonia for seven years.

In her detective work, Antonia, an AIDS doctor, uncovers another life that Massimo has lived.

Enter handsome Michele ( played by Stefano Accorci), who lives an openly gay life, filled with friends, some straight, some gay, some transgendered. Michele is real, flaws and all and conveys the promiscuous life of a lusty gay male.

Antonia and Michele fight a burgeoning attraction for each other with Antonia repulsed at times by his sexuality with other men. She also becomes bonded with his friends (she has made Massimo her raison d'etre and abandoned other friends for him) and slowly begins to understand his grief process.

Nothing is drawn in black and white here. One senses that Antonia and Michele are right for each other. Massimo was never an intellectual whereas Michele and Antonia are. There are many layers to the story and some wonderful characterizations. The part of Antonia's mother is a particular delight as is the part of Serra, they both have their secrets too.

I gave it a 9 out of 10 for the Italy that it shows, a colourful, complex Italy and the characters that clamp around the heartstrings and don't release for a long time afterwards. The only flaw was in the measly subtitles but at times my Italian was good enough to pick up the nuances and the unsubtitled dialogue and background.

Bravo and Brava to all.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9043,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-03-16","keywords":"aids,caught in the rain,purchase,inscription,watching tv","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer italiano ufficiale [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3764632089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTc1NTNmZGEtY2ExMC00Mjc5LWI3MzAtZTFjMWYzY2YwZTJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTc1NTNmZGEtY2ExMC00Mjc5LWI3MzAtZTFjMWYzY2YwZTJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125540/","name":"Margherita Buy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0009629/","name":"Stefano Accorsi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0948012/","name":"Serra Yilmaz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654858/","name":"Ferzan Ozpetek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021904/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069277/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004166/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0739744/","name":"Gianni Romoli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654858/","name":"Ferzan Ozpetek"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.category: Drama, Romance, Drama, Romance
programme.review: --- Actors: Margherita Buy (role=Antonia), Stefano Accorsi (role=Michele), Serra Yilmaz (role=Serra), Gabriel Garko (role=Ernesto), Erika Blanc (role=Veronica), Andrea Renzi (role=Massimo), Koray Candemir (role=Emir), Lucrezia Valia (role=Mara), Filippo Nigro (role=Riccardo), Ivan Bacchi (role=Luciano), Maurizio Romoli (role=Angelo), Carmine Recano (role=Israele)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0274497, Title: Le fate ignoranti, --- Description: Le fate ignoranti: Directed by Ferzan Ozpetek. With Margherita Buy, Stefano Accorsi, Serra Yilmaz, Gabriel Garko. After a deathly car accident, Antonia starts dating her husband's friends and finds the truth about his life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0274497/","name":"Le fate ignoranti","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQwMmU2N2EtNWU2Yi00NzY5LWFlZjUtNjBiOGVhNzAwNzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIzNDU1NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a deathly car accident, Antonia starts dating her husband's friends and finds the truth about his life.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0274497/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"wisewebwoman","dateCreated":"2007-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"A redefinition of family","reviewBody":"This was a chance rental, recommended by the owner of my local rental shop and it was a wonderful surprise. We are introduced to the perfect marriage at the outset, Antonia, the wife (played winningly by Margherita Buy) and Massimo, the husband ( played by Andrea Renzi) It is fifteen years along into the marriage straight out of high school and it is sexy and fulfilling, with a wonderful house on a lake, a full time maid and no children by choice.

And just like that, Massimo is killed in a traffic accident and thus begins the story of the unfolding of the secret that he withheld from Antonia for seven years.

In her detective work, Antonia, an AIDS doctor, uncovers another life that Massimo has lived.

Enter handsome Michele ( played by Stefano Accorci), who lives an openly gay life, filled with friends, some straight, some gay, some transgendered. Michele is real, flaws and all and conveys the promiscuous life of a lusty gay male.

Antonia and Michele fight a burgeoning attraction for each other with Antonia repulsed at times by his sexuality with other men. She also becomes bonded with his friends (she has made Massimo her raison d'etre and abandoned other friends for him) and slowly begins to understand his grief process.

Nothing is drawn in black and white here. One senses that Antonia and Michele are right for each other. Massimo was never an intellectual whereas Michele and Antonia are. There are many layers to the story and some wonderful characterizations. The part of Antonia's mother is a particular delight as is the part of Serra, they both have their secrets too.

I gave it a 9 out of 10 for the Italy that it shows, a colourful, complex Italy and the characters that clamp around the heartstrings and don't release for a long time afterwards. The only flaw was in the measly subtitles but at times my Italian was good enough to pick up the nuances and the unsubtitled dialogue and background.

Bravo and Brava to all.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9043,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-03-16","keywords":"aids,caught in the rain,purchase,inscription,watching tv","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer italiano ufficiale [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3764632089","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTc1NTNmZGEtY2ExMC00Mjc5LWI3MzAtZTFjMWYzY2YwZTJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTc1NTNmZGEtY2ExMC00Mjc5LWI3MzAtZTFjMWYzY2YwZTJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125540/","name":"Margherita Buy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0009629/","name":"Stefano Accorsi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0948012/","name":"Serra Yilmaz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654858/","name":"Ferzan Ozpetek"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021904/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069277/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004166/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0739744/","name":"Gianni Romoli","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654858/","name":"Ferzan Ozpetek"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Une semaine de vacances
A Week's Holiday
programme.desc:
Une semaine de vacances: Directed by Bertrand Tavernier. With Nathalie Baye, Gérard Lanvin, Flore Fitzgerald, Michel Galabru. Laurence, a young schoolteacher from Lyons, takes a week's leave. During the break, she reflects on her career and her personal life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0081686/","name":"Une semaine de vacances","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGNkZTY4N2QtZGQ2ZC00MTAxLTljNmQtZWFmZWNjNWM3MDFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQzMzQzODY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Laurence, a young schoolteacher from Lyons, takes a week's leave. During the break, she reflects on her career and her personal life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0081686/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hof-4"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Early middle age crisis","reviewBody":"Laurence (Nathalie Baye), thirty one years old, is a high school French teacher in Lyon. She has a good relation with her students, genuinely cares for them and they appreciate her efforts. She is reasonably attractive, charismatic and socially adept with neighbors and colleagues (one of them, a woman endowed with a oversized sense of humor is her best friend). She gets along well with her parents, which are aging in apparent harmony in a small village nearby and even with her ne'er-do-well brother Jacques. Her boyfriend Pierre is at times overbearing and unsubtle, but sincerely loves her and dreams of having a child with her. At times, he seems to know her better than she herself does. Her friend urges her to formalize her relationship with Pierre and start a family before her biological clock winds down.

All of this changes one morning, when Laurence has a near panic attack, is unable to face her class and misses school. She is given a week's vacation to sort out her (unexplained) problems. She reexamines her life in a new and rather negative light; in spite of her efforts her student's writing is full of cliches and platitudes, a neighbor responds improperly to her kindness and she tries clumsily to find a pretext to break up with Pierre. At this point, order and purpose disappear and we are faced with the chaos of real life; motivations are unclear or missing, actions have unexpected reactions and plans seem not to work any longer. Whether Laurence will strike a new path or go back to her previous life after the week's vacation is left open.

The movie rests squarely on Baye's shoulders; she is in almost every scene. She does an excellent job. The other actors are at the same level, among them Tavernier regular Philippe Noiret in a short role. The script is spare and (as the movie requires) does not attempt to weave a conventional plot. A successful movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":562,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1980-06-02","keywords":"lyon,depressed woman,time in title,number 1 in title,fear of commitment","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000882/","name":"Nathalie Baye"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0487254/","name":"Gérard Lanvin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0280236/","name":"Flore Fitzgerald"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851724/","name":"Bertrand Tavernier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046777/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0530809/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069857/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0360579/","name":"Marie-Françoise Hans"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851724/","name":"Bertrand Tavernier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851725/","name":"Colo Tavernier"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Broderskab
Bratstvo
programme.desc: Broderskab: Directed by Nicolo Donato. With Thure Lindhardt, David Dencik, Nicolas Bro, Morten Holst. Former Danish servicemen Lars and Jimmy are thrown together while training in a neo-Nazi group. Moving from hostility through to friendship and finally passion, events take a darker turn when it's discovered." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1327820/","name":"Broderskab","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjczOTI2OTAxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzg2MzUwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Former Danish servicemen Lars and Jimmy are thrown together while training in a neo-Nazi group. Moving from hostility through to friendship and finally passion, events take a darker turn when it's discovered.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1327820/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"smsandersen1974"},"dateCreated":"2010-04-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant performances in a movie far better than I had expected","reviewBody":"The strength of this movie definitely lies with the brilliant actors in it and the director's ability to let them shine.\n\nI didn't expect the story and the plot to be perfect and it wasn't. The main character Lars' decision to get involved with the Nazi community is a tiny bit contrived but no more than you would expect when it is told with a few short scenes before the movie is allowed to focus on the human aspects of the story and dwell on the consequences of the character's action without being judgmental or painting any of the characters solely in black or white. Something that is rather a bit of an achievement with this particular subject matter. Enough good cannot be said of the amazingly honest and heart-wrenching performances of the two lead actors. They are both incredibly talented and the director obviously appreciated this. The result is a chilling but also a very intimate and at times tender film. Well worth seeing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3241,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-04-08","keywords":"skinny dipping,hospital,house improvement,beer drinking,islamophobia","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Brotherhood","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi637180697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYxMjEwMDIzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDE2MDUyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYxMjEwMDIzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDE2MDUyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":""Brotherhood" trailer from Olive Films."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0511892/","name":"Thure Lindhardt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1399770/","name":"David Dencik"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110334/","name":"Nicolas Bro"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1645978/","name":"Nicolo Donato"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016149/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001935/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048411/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3213566/","name":"Rasmus Birch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1645978/","name":"Nicolo Donato"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bab el hadid
Glavna železnička stanica
programme.desc: Bab el hadid: Directed by Youssef Chahine. With Farid Shawqi, Hind Rustum, Youssef Chahine, Hassan el Baroudi. A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0051390/","name":"Bab el hadid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE1YTc4MTEtNGFkZC00YmFkLWFiZDItOTljMTI1YTM2NDRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4NzAzNjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0051390/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chaos-rampant"},"dateCreated":"2009-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark character-driven film with psychosexual undertones","reviewBody":"I don't really agree with certain circles who claim Cairo Station "one of the greatest films ever made" but it's a neat little film. It has that very basic, almost primitive, shooting style and editing which in some ways reminds of me Greek romance melodramas from the same time yet the perverse content sets it worlds apart from that kind of populist cinema which I suspect was as popular with lower/middle-class audiences in Egypt as it was in Greece. I liked that Chahine makes the titular railway station a stage for contrast between the old and the new. Between fashionable swinging Egyptians and the traditional Muslim conservatives. Between a lady president dressed in a modern pantsuit and destitute girls selling soda to the passengers. Between the old feudal faction of porters and the new one trying to assert its working rights by forming a union. This sociopolitical contrast touching on contemporary changes in Egyptian society (which, other than what the movie presents, I know nothing about but seem to be almost identical with the anxieties that surfaced in Greek screwball comedies of the same time) reflected in the movie itself, out of a typical melodrama of thwarted love Chahine dragging a dark noirish thriller with psychosexual undertones and an almost slasher-like turn in the third act replete with knife-wielding crazies chasing beautiful women that predates Psycho by a good two years. In borrowing the generic aspects of a programme picture for his character-driven piece and portraying his mentally imbalanced protagonist with sympathy and humanity, Chahine made a movie more wholesome than its 73 minute duration would suggest."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4175,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1962-01-16","keywords":"train,working class,labor union,union,buxom","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790096/","name":"Farid Shawqi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744600/","name":"Hind Rustum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149631/","name":"Youssef Chahine"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149631/","name":"Youssef Chahine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011976/","name":"Abdel Hai Adib"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0009455/","name":"Mohamed Abu Youssef"}],"duration":"PT1H17M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0051390, Title: Bab el hadid, --- Description: Bab el hadid: Directed by Youssef Chahine. With Farid Shawqi, Hind Rustum, Youssef Chahine, Hassan el Baroudi. A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0051390/","name":"Bab el hadid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE1YTc4MTEtNGFkZC00YmFkLWFiZDItOTljMTI1YTM2NDRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4NzAzNjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0051390/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"chaos-rampant","dateCreated":"2009-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark character-driven film with psychosexual undertones","reviewBody":"I don't really agree with certain circles who claim Cairo Station "one of the greatest films ever made" but it's a neat little film. It has that very basic, almost primitive, shooting style and editing which in some ways reminds of me Greek romance melodramas from the same time yet the perverse content sets it worlds apart from that kind of populist cinema which I suspect was as popular with lower/middle-class audiences in Egypt as it was in Greece. I liked that Chahine makes the titular railway station a stage for contrast between the old and the new. Between fashionable swinging Egyptians and the traditional Muslim conservatives. Between a lady president dressed in a modern pantsuit and destitute girls selling soda to the passengers. Between the old feudal faction of porters and the new one trying to assert its working rights by forming a union. This sociopolitical contrast touching on contemporary changes in Egyptian society (which, other than what the movie presents, I know nothing about but seem to be almost identical with the anxieties that surfaced in Greek screwball comedies of the same time) reflected in the movie itself, out of a typical melodrama of thwarted love Chahine dragging a dark noirish thriller with psychosexual undertones and an almost slasher-like turn in the third act replete with knife-wielding crazies chasing beautiful women that predates Psycho by a good two years. In borrowing the generic aspects of a programme picture for his character-driven piece and portraying his mentally imbalanced protagonist with sympathy and humanity, Chahine made a movie more wholesome than its 73 minute duration would suggest.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4175,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1962-01-16","keywords":"train,working class,labor union,union,buxom","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790096/","name":"Farid Shawqi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744600/","name":"Hind Rustum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149631/","name":"Youssef Chahine"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149631/","name":"Youssef Chahine"],"creator":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011976/","name":"Abdel Hai Adib","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0009455/","name":"Mohamed Abu Youssef"],"duration":"PT1H17M"</script><metacontent="
